block.p: Samantha Noelle Bishopp, a daughter of Claudia Reynaud Bishopp and Malcolm F. Bishopp, both of New York, was married yesterday to Ryan DeForest Mollett, a son of Dorothy Mollett and Richard C. Mollett of Taneytown, Md. The Rev. Dr. William F. R. Gilroy, a Lutheran minister, officiated at Antrim 1844, a Taneytown inn that is owned by the bridegroom's parents.

Mrs. Mollett, 28, works in New York as an editor in the fashion department at Glamour magazine. She graduated from Vanderbilt. Her father is a managing director at Allianz Global Investors in New York. Her mother is an interpreter at the United Nations.

Samantha Noelle Bishopp, a daughter of Claudia Reynaud Bishopp and Malcolm F. Bishopp, both of New York, was married yesterday to Ryan DeForest Mollett, a son of Dorothy Mollett and Richard C. Mollett of Taneytown, Md. The Rev. Dr. William F. R. Gilroy, a Lutheran minister, officiated at Antrim 1844, a Taneytown inn that is owned by the bridegroomâ€™s parents.

Samantha Noelle Bishopp, a daughter of Claudia Reynaud Bishopp and Malcolm F. Bishopp, both of New York, was married yesterday to Ryan DeForest Mollett, a son of Dorothy Mollett and Richard C. Mollett of Taneytown, Md. The Rev. Dr. William F. R. Gilroy, a Lutheran minister, officiated at Antrim 1844, a Taneytown inn that is owned by the bridegroom's parents.

Mrs. Mollett, 28, works in New York as an editor in the fashion department at Glamour magazine. She graduated from Vanderbilt. Her father is a managing director at Allianz Global Investors in New York. Her mother is an interpreter at the United Nations.

Mr. Mollett, also 28, received an M.B.A. degree from Yale last week and this month is to become an associate at BlackRock, the investment firm in New York. He graduated from Princeton, where he was a captain of the 2001 lacrosse team, which won the national championship. He is now a defenseman for the New Jersey Pride, a professional lacrosse team in New Brunswick.
